sentence.Network_cn: 他患有无法根治的皮肤病。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin incurabilis, from in- 'not' + curabilis (see curable)

entry.tran: (疾病)无法治愈的，不可医治的
entry.def: If someone has an incurable disease, they cannot be cured of it.

example.ex: He is suffering from an incurable skin disease.
example.tran: 他患有无法根治的皮肤病。

entry.tran: 无法改变的;无可救药的
entry.def: You can use incurable to indicate that someone has a particular quality or attitude and will not change.

example.ex: Poor old William is an incurable romantic...
example.tran: 可怜的老威廉是个无可救药的浪漫主义者。

example.ex: You are either very young or an incurable optimist.
example.tran: 你要么非常年轻,要么是个不可救药的乐天派。

means.word_mean: 1. a person whose disease is incurable
1. being such that a cure is impossible;

auth_sentence.content: The faults of James's head and heart were incurable.

Sentence.sentence: A 23-year-old girl with an incurable disease can fly to Alaska and everything can work out.

sentences.en: All three babies were born with an incurable heart condition.
sentences.cn: 三个婴儿都有不可治瘉的先天性心脏病。
